title: Present Simple Tense
explanation: 현재 시제는 습관적인 행동이나 일반적인 사실을 표현할 때 사용합니다.
rules: 부정문: I don't study / He doesn't study
의문문: Do you study? / Does he study?
exampleSentences: I study English every day.
She works at a hospital.
They don't like coffee.
Do you speak Korean?

title: Present Continuous Tense
explanation: 현재 진행형은 지금 진행 중인 행동을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I am studying English now.
She is working on her project.
They are not watching TV.
What are you doing?

title: Past Simple Tense
explanation: 과거 시제는 과거에 일어난 일을 표현할 때 사용합니다.
rules: 부정문: I didn't study / He didn't go
의문문: Did you study? / Did he go?
exampleSentences: I studied English last night.
She went to Paris last year.
They didn't watch the movie.
Did you finish your homework?

title: Future Tense (will)
explanation: 미래 시제는 미래에 일어날 일을 표현할 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I will study harder next semester.
She will visit Korea next month.
They won't be late.
Will you help me with this?

title: Articles (a, an, the)
explanation: 관사는 명사 앞에 사용하여 특정성을 나타냅니다.
rules: a는 자음 앞, an은 모음 앞
exampleSentences: I have a book.
She ate an apple.
The book on the table is mine.
He is a doctor.

title: Prepositions of Time
explanation: 시간 전치사는 시간을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
rules: in: 월, 년, 계절 (in June, in 2024)
exampleSentences: I wake up at 7 AM.
My birthday is on May 5th.
We go swimming in summer.
She was born in 1990.

title: Pronouns
explanation: 대명사는 명사를 대신하여 사용하는 단어입니다.
rules: 주격: I, you, he, she, it, we, they
목적격: me, you, him, her, it, us, them
소유격: my, your, his, her, its, our, their
exampleSentences: I like him, but he doesn't like me.
This is my book, not yours.
She gave them her phone number.
It is their house.

title: Question Words
explanation: 의문사는 질문을 만들 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: What is your name?
Who is that person?
Where do you live?
When did you arrive?
Why are you sad?
How do you do this?

title: Plural Nouns
explanation: 복수 명사는 둘 이상의 사물을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
rules: 자음+y로 끝나는 명사: y를 i로 바꾸고 -es (city → cities)
exampleSentences: I have three books.
There are many boxes in the room.
Two children are playing.
Many people like this.

title: Possessive Forms
explanation: 소유격은 소유 관계를 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: This is Mary's car.
The teachers' room is on the second floor.
The children's playground is big.
My brother's friend is nice.

title: Present Perfect Tense
explanation: 현재완료는 과거에 시작된 일이 현재까지 영향을 미치거나 완료되었음을 나타냅니다.
exampleSentences: I have lived in Seoul for 5 years.
She has finished her homework.
They haven't eaten lunch yet.
Have you ever been to Japan?

title: Comparatives and Superlatives
explanation: 비교급과 최상급은 둘 이상을 비교할 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: She is taller than her brother.
This is the most interesting book I've ever read.
English is easier than I thought.
He is the best student in the class.

title: Modal Verbs (can, should, must)
explanation: 조동사는 가능성, 의무, 허가 등을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I can speak English.
You should study more.
We must finish this today.
Can you help me?

title: Conditional Sentences (Type 1)
explanation: 조건문은 특정 조건이 충족될 때 일어날 일을 표현합니다.
exampleSentences: If it rains, I will stay home.
If you study hard, you will pass the exam.
We will go to the beach if the weather is nice.
When I finish my homework, I will watch TV.

title: Past Continuous Tense
explanation: 과거 진행형은 과거의 특정 시점에 진행 중이던 행동을 나타냅니다.
exampleSentences: I was studying when you called.
They were playing soccer at 5 PM.
She wasn't listening to the teacher.
What were you doing yesterday?

title: Used to
explanation: Used to는 과거의 습관이나 상태를 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I used to play tennis when I was young.
She used to live in New York.
We didn't use to have smartphones.
Did you use to study French?

title: Too and Enough
explanation: Too와 enough는 정도를 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: This coffee is too hot to drink.
She is old enough to drive.
I don't have enough money.
He speaks too fast.

title: Adverbs of Frequency
explanation: 빈도 부사는 행동의 빈도를 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
rules: always, usually, often, sometimes, rarely, never
문장 앞이나 뒤에도 올 수 있음
exampleSentences: I always brush my teeth before bed.
She is usually late.
We sometimes go to the movies.
They never eat fast food.

title: Some and Any
explanation: Some과 any는 불특정 수량을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I have some friends in Seoul.
Do you have any questions?
There isn't any milk in the fridge.
Would you like some coffee?

title: Future Forms (going to)
explanation: Be going to는 계획된 미래 행동을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I am going to visit my grandmother tomorrow.
She is going to study abroad next year.
It's going to rain soon.
Are you going to buy a new car?

title: Passive Voice
explanation: 수동태는 행동의 대상을 강조할 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: English is spoken all over the world.
The book was written by Shakespeare.
The homework will be checked tomorrow.
The house is being built now.

title: Reported Speech
explanation: 간접화법은 다른 사람이 한 말을 전달할 때 사용합니다.
rules: 시간 표현 변화: today → that day, tomorrow → the next day
exampleSentences: He said, 'I am tired.' → He said (that) he was tired.
She told me, 'I will help you.' → She told me (that) she would help me.
They said, 'We can do it.' → They said (that) they could do it.

title: Relative Clauses
explanation: 관계절은 명사를 수식하는 절입니다.
exampleSentences: The person who called you is my friend.
This is the book which I bought yesterday.
Seoul is the city where I was born.
I know a teacher that speaks five languages.

title: Gerunds and Infinitives
explanation: 동명사와 부정사는 동사를 명사처럼 사용하는 방법입니다.
rules: 일부 동사는 둘 다 사용 가능
exampleSentences: I enjoy reading books. (동명사)
I want to learn English. (부정사)
She likes swimming. (동명사)
They decided to go home. (부정사)

title: Conditional Sentences (Type 2)
explanation: 가정법 과거는 현재 사실과 반대되는 가정을 나타냅니다.
exampleSentences: If I were rich, I would travel the world.
If she studied harder, she would pass the exam.
What would you do if you won the lottery?
If I had more time, I would learn another language.

title: Present Perfect Continuous
explanation: 현재완료 진행형은 과거에 시작해서 현재까지 계속되는 행동을 나타냅니다.
exampleSentences: I have been studying English for three hours.
She has been working here since 2020.
They have been waiting for you.
How long have you been living in Seoul?

title: Wish and If only
explanation: Wish와 if only는 현재나 과거의 아쉬움을 표현할 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I wish I were taller.
She wishes she had more free time.
I wish I had studied harder.
If only I could speak Spanish!

title: Causative Verbs (have, get, make)
explanation: 사역동사는 다른 사람에게 무언가를 시키거나 하게 할 때 사용합니다.
exampleSentences: I had my hair cut yesterday.
She got him to help her.
The teacher made us do our homework.
They had the house painted.

title: Inversion
explanation: 도치는 강조나 형식적인 문체를 위해 어순을 바꾸는 것입니다.
rules: 부정 부사구로 시작: Never/Rarely/Seldom + 동사 + 주어
only로 시작: Only then/Only after + 동사 + 주어
exampleSentences: Never have I seen such a beautiful sunset.
Rarely does he arrive on time.
Only then did I realize my mistake.
Had I known, I would have come earlier.

title: Subjunctive Mood
explanation: 가정법은 제안, 요구, 중요성을 나타낼 때 사용합니다.
rules: It is important/necessary + that + 주어 + (should) + 동사원형
exampleSentences: I suggest that he study harder.
The doctor recommended that she take more rest.
It is important that everyone be on time.
They insisted that the meeting be postponed.
